page.title: 20HUTTON ESTATE - SKELTON SHOW
page.content: Every year the Skelton Horticultural and Agricultural Society's annual show is held in the Old Park on the third Saturday in August. Although the Society is over 100 years old, the 1985 Show will be the Ninety Fifth. Originally one of many small village shows, it was held at Skelton, but it has thrived while others have died and has been at Hutton for a number of years. The Skelton Show has now become one of the premier smaller shows in the North of England. The 1984 Show had over 1300 livestock exhibits, and 1000 entries in the industrial section, while a crowd of more than 10000 attended. In addition to the competitive classes, there is a number of attractions, including the Lakeland Country Princess Competition.
